definition: (coll.) to fall or drop in price/to go down in price
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Business is possible if you can lower the price to HK$2150.
sentences.chinese: 你方若能落价到2150港币，年夜概成交。

definition: to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
(of a price) to fluctuate according to the market/to sell at the market price
merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
